head.title: The Gates to College Should Be Open to All

hedline.hl1: The Gates to College Should Be Open to All

abstract.p: Letter from SUNY president Shirley Strum Kenny disputes October 17 article on rise in college tuitions

block.p: Your Oct. 17 news article about the rise in college tuitions doesn't mention a salient point. Even before this relatively small increase, college was still unattainable for far too many Americans.
Your Oct. 17 news article about the rise in college tuitions doesn't mention a salient point. Even before this relatively small increase, college was still unattainable for far too many Americans.
College should now be considered a right for every American who can benefit from it.

The idea that completing high school is adequate preparation for professional life is outdated. In today's information age, business leaders continually emphasize that a college-educated work force is critical to sustaining national progress and prosperity.
It's time for higher education to become universally accessible in the form of guaranteed federal financial scholarship aid for the first two years of college to all academically qualified students.
Within the next decade, that support should be extended to a full four years.
SHIRLEY STRUM KENNY Stony Brook, N.Y., Oct. 18, 2000
The writer is president, State University of New York at Stony Brook.
